title: Wire Broadcaster to push real-time events to connected clients
description:
Phase 1 Success Criteria #2: "See events from other connected characters in same location"

The Broadcaster component exists but isn't wired to push events to connected clients in real-time.

## Current State
- Broadcaster exists in internal/core with Subscribe/Publish
- ConnectionHandler processes commands and sends responses
- Events are persisted to EventStore
- Events are replayed on reconnect

## Missing
- When a character does `say` or `pose`, other connected characters in the same location don't see it in real-time
- Need to wire: Engine -> Broadcaster -> ConnectionHandlers

## Implementation
1. ConnectionHandler subscribes to location stream on connect
2. Engine publishes events to Broadcaster after persisting
3. Broadcaster delivers to all subscribed ConnectionHandlers
4. ConnectionHandler.sendEvent() formats and sends to client

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Two telnet clients connected to same location
- [ ] Client A does `say hello`
- [ ] Client B sees the message in real-time (not just on reconnect)
- [ ] Works for both say and pose events
close_reason: Completed in commit 563024e

title: Wire WASM plugins to event stream
description:
Phase 1 Success Criteria #4: "WASM plugin receives events, can emit responses"

The wazero plugin host exists as a proof-of-concept but isn't connected to the event system.

## Current State
- PluginHost exists in internal/wasm with LoadPlugin/CallFunction
- Basic WASM execution works (math add function test)
- No connection to game events

## Required
- Plugin can subscribe to event streams
- Plugin receives events when they occur
- Plugin can emit events back to the game

## Implementation
1. Define plugin API for event handling (host functions)
2. Create example plugin that responds to events (e.g., echo bot)
3. Wire PluginHost to Broadcaster to receive events
4. Add capability for plugin to emit events

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Example WASM plugin loaded on server start
- [ ] Plugin receives say events from location stream
- [ ] Plugin can emit a response event (e.g., "Echo: <message>")
- [ ] Response appears to connected clients
close_reason: Completed in commit 563024e
